page.title: 03SHOPS IN LONG ASHTON
page.content: In Long Ashton there are only a few shops on the main road, but down a side road there is a parade of shops. There are no large shops,apart from a 'Gateway' supermarket. They are all small private concerns. In 'Gateway' we go around the shop, picking food and cleaning materials from the shelves and putting them in a basket or trolley. On each item there is a sticky label showing its price.The shops I visit most are the post office, because my mum is a post lady; the newsagents, to collect my comics; and 'Homes and Gardens', because I am a keen gardener. Other shops include an antique shop, an off-licence, a Chinese take-away and a hairdresser's. Everywhere there is a friendly service.
